content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map during these steps. Multiple attempts were made to supply a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5), but placement failed due to missing items in the inventory. Although furnace entities (an alternative furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)) were retrieved for smelting processes, they appear to be pre‐existing and were not created by the agent in these steps.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Usage Errors with get_entities  
  – When calling get_entities, avoid passing unexpected keyword arguments (e.g., “radius”) or unsupported positional parameters. Adhere to its defined signature to prevent argument-related TypeErrors.

• Entity Placement Failures  
  – Before attempting to place a structure (such as the Lab), confirm that the required entity exists in the inventory and that the target position is valid. Lack of inventory leads to placement errors.

• Iteration on Null Results  
  – Check that functions returning collections (like get_entities) do not return None before iterating over their results. Using a fallback (such as an empty list) helps prevent “NoneType” iteration errors.

• Incomplete Crafting Chain and Missing Sub-ingredients  
  – Ensure that all prerequisite resources and production capabilities are in place. Failures in crafting the Lab indicate missing sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) due to an incomplete supply chain (e.g., insufficient iron-plates or copper-plates and missing production machines for smelting or assembling).  
  – Reconcile recipe requirements with available resources and verify that each stage in the production chain is operational before reattempting complex crafts.
